Text:
Hearing that her dear lord has come calling, Gamma
turns her work over to her subordinates and hurries
to the Hall of Shadows.

Clad in a thin, black dress with a dash of refreshing
perfume, she steps into the hall.
Her lord is contemplating the sky from a window.

His sharp gaze rests on either the thunderclouds or
perhaps something else entirely.
Gamma is unable to read his eyes as of yet.
Thank you for blessing us with your presence.
With what may I assist you this—
Agh!
—fine day...?
Your nose is bleeding.
I have a request.
Gamma's master turns his gaze to her as he spoke.

Her heart flutters at the sight of those ever-bold
eyes, and the slightly out-of-place hope that he
would notice her new hairdo pops into her head.

Such courtesy is wasted on me. You have but to speak
whatever it is you need.

I want to enter the Bushin Festival under a false
identity.

So spoke her lord. And no sooner had he done so than
the gears of Gamma's keen intellect begin turning at
terrifying speed.

She deduces his intentions and puts her mind to work
earnestly guessing what deeper aims lay beyond.

(Still...I cannot infer what he is thinking. Why
would he need to go to such lengths?)

It is no use—the answer to the riddle eludes her.
So she hides her shame and asks.
A false identity? But why?
Gamma's lord averts his eyes.
Would you mind...not asking me that?
*gasp*

The moment her lord's gaze leaves her, Gamma feels
as if she has lost his interest, causing her own eyes
to quiver.

A thought had occurred to Gamma when she heard that
her lord had battled Aurora, the Calamity Witch—

Would she have been able to deduce his intentions had
she been there?
She is not confident she could have.

Not one of the Shadow Garden members there had been
able to do so.

However, her lord's choice had ended up being the
optimal one, proving that none of them could even
approach his level.

If Gamma had been present, though, she would have had
no choice to but to try and guess his motives.

She is the brains of the Shadow Garden, after all.
That is what she is here to do.

If she can't, then she has no place in this
organization.
(And yet here I am—messing up again.)
Don't worry, it's something I can't tell anyone.

Gamma can't get a read on any of it—neither his
intentions nor his mood.

(What an abject failure on my part. Mindlessly doing
as I'm told would be vastly preferable to this.)
I...see. Then I shall refrain from asking.
Bring it here.

Gamma motions to a subordinate who brings forth a
certain item.
Now if you will excuse me, my lord.
Hm? What's this?

Slime—modified based on your god-like Shadow Wisdom.
By running magic through it, it takes on the exact same
feeling as skin.
Now just apply it like so...
Nice how anyone can use it.
I currently have Eta producing it in mass quantities.

But this just feels like I have clay stuck to my
face.

Next we will carve the slime and color it so you
resemble a different person.
Gotcha.
What kind of face would you like?
Something kinda weak.
Weak...
Well then, how about this fellow here?

Mundane Mann. Lazy and unskilled as a dark knight,
he was disowned from the nobility five years ago and
passed away in obscurity.
Your builds are similar, so he would be a good fit.
I like it. He's got the perfect face and backstory.
Make me into Mundane.
It shall be done.
Let us begin!
Gamma presses a switch on the device.
The slime is sculpted in the blink of an eye.
What do you think?
Oh yeah, I see it now...!
I look like a real wuss!

...Suppose I'd better slouch if I wanna really fit
the part, huh.

Sloped shoulders and a dull voice and expression
ought to help, too.
Excellently done, my lord.

You once said that posture and gait can reveal how
physically adept a person is.

And here I see that you have put those words into
practice masterfully.

(Gamma remembers and even understands every bit of
knowledge I drop.)

(Guess this crazy disguise kit is one of the fruits
of that.)
Heh, brains... It's all about brains.

We have also prepared a selection of clothing and
swords, all cheap and sec—
Gyah!
Ah! Agh...!
(Her motor coordination couldn't be any worse.)
Second-hand.
Your nose is bleeding.

Though blood drips from Gamma's nostrils after
faceplanting on the floor, she couldn't have looked
any happier.
